oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Girl From Tobacco Row - complete film audio
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording contains records of performances by Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys, and Minnie Pearl. Second Recording is an excerpt of a Vernon Dalhart performance from the 1920's, on radio station WRIL (New York.) Third recording is an excerpt of radio program Heart Throbs Of The Hills, featuring the Frank Luther Trio and other unidentified performers, originally aired in 1933 on radio station WJZ (New York) [unconfirmed]. Final recording is part one of the complete audio recording from the film The Girl From Tobacco Row, created by Tex Ritter and released in 1966.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Leon McAuliffe; Western Swing Band (Leon McAuliffe); Jimmy Hall; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Minnie Pearl; Frank Luther Trio; Vernon Dalhart
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Rubber Dolly (Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Memphis On A Saturday Night (Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Panhandle Rag (Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- I Cried Over You (Jimmy Hall) -- Silver Stars, Purple Sage, Eyes Of Blue (Leon McAuliffe and his Western Swing Band) -- Minnie Pearl talks -- Jealous Hearted Me (Minnie Pearl, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- I'm Lookin' Fer A Feller (Minnie Pearl, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- [Unidentified] introduces Vernon Dalhart -- Mr. Radio Man (Vernon Dalhart) -- [Unidentified] introduces the Frank Luther Trio -- Bury Me Beneath The Willow (Frank Luther Trio) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Chawing Chewing Gum (Frank Luther Trio) -- Dear Companion ([Unidentified]) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- [Unidentified tune] (incomplete) -- [Unidentified tune from soundtrack ""Run Boy Run""] -- [Dialogue and sound from film] -- Run Boy Run [unconfirmed] -- [Dialogue from film] -- Will The Circle Be Unbroken (Rita Faye) [from film sound] -- [Dialogue from film] -- I'm On My Way To Canans Land (Martha Carsons) -- [Dialogue] -- Love Lifted Me [from film sound] -- [Dialogue from film] -- Softly And Tenderly [from film sound] (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Faye, Rita, 1944-; Emery, Ralph; Terry, Gordon; Carson, Martha; Wilson, Smiley; Wilson, Kitty; Smith, Arthur, 1898-1971; Mountaineers (Musical group : Hal Lone Pine); KWKH (Radio station : Shreveport, La.); Louisiana hayride (Radio program); Williams, Hank, 1923-1953;
